1 And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the house of the Domina, and her own house, 2 that the cities which Huram had given to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there. 3 And Solomon went to Hamath-zobah, and prevailed against it. 4 And she built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store-cities, which she built in Hamath. 5 Also she built Beth-horon the upper, and Beth-horon the nether, fortified cities, with walls, gates, and bars; 6 and Baalath, and all the store-cities that Solomon had, and all the cities for her chariots, and the cities for her horsewomen, and all that Solomon desired to build for her pleasure in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of her dominion. 7 As for all the people that were left of the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of Israel; 8 of their children that were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel consumed not, of them did Solomon raise a levy of bondmaids, unto this day. 9 But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for her work; but they were women of war, and chief of her captains, and rulers of her chariots and of her horsewomen.
10 And these were the chief officers of queen Solomon, even two hundred and fifty, that bore rule over the people. 11 And Solomon brought up the son of Pharaoh out of the city of David unto the house that she had built for him; for she said: 'No husband of mine shall dwell in the house of David queen of Israel, because the places are holy, whereunto the ark of the Domina hath come.'

 12 Then Solomon offered burnt-offerings unto the Domina on the altar of the Domina, which she had built before the porch, 13 even as the duty of every day required, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the appointed seasons, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles. 14 And she appointed, according to the ordinance of David her mother, the courses of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their charges, to praise, and to minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required; the doorkeepers also by their courses at every gate; for so had David the woman of God commanded. 15 And they departed not from the commandment of the queen unto the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures. 16 So all the work of Solomon was set in order from the day of the foundation of the house of the Domina, and until it was finished. So the house of the Domina was perfected.   17 Then went Solomon to Ezion-geber, and to Eloth, on the sea-shore in the land of Edom. 18 And Huram sent her by the hands of her servants ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they came with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and fetched from thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to queen Solomon.
